website_summaries.verdict: The slightly thicker material of this keyboard makes this model a little more durable without sacrificing flexibility.
pros: Made from thicker silicone material than comparable keyboards
Provides more protection for the internal components of the unit, meaning keys are less likely to stop working than on other models
Just as flexible and portable as other roll up keyboards
The soft material makes for silent typing, and offers the waterproof and dust-proof protection of other silicone models
cons: Perhaps due to the thicker material, the keys on this unit are less responsive than some other models

customer_reviews.title: Changing my review
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son to use with his old laptop that has lost some keys. Somehow they sent the order twice but I figured I'd keep both. The first broke about a week later and the space key stopped working after about 3 weeks, Not great quality. The company contacted me after this review and told me the hold the keyboard vertically and shake it. It seems to have done the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has such an awesome design, which is why I am sad to see it be such a bad input device. I'm a touch typer, but even slowly hunting and pecking often resulted in keys being not detected, or detected twice, or possibly the key right next to it getting detected instead. I cannot, though careful typing, enter a 16 letter password correctly more than 30% of the time. Worst of all, after just a few months of light use, the g key completely broke, no longer getting detected. Overall, not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: I travel a lot and hate using the laptop keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot and hate using the laptop keyboard. This keyboard rolls up and fits into the pocket of my laptop case, it's roughly the size of a pc mouse when rolled up ! The placement of the letters are exactly that of a keyboard and it works great. I probably have to bear down a little more when I type, but other than that it's wonderful !
customer_reviews.author: Milinda

customer_reviews.title: Great little keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. Take it with me for work. Very easy to transport. Rolls up and fits in the little cardboard box its packaged in. Works great. Keys work well. Fits hand like a regular keyboard. Nice finish. Glad I bought it, I'd buy again, and I recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: mystery book lover

customer_reviews.title: Not durable!
customer_reviews.text: Lasted about a month....maybe a total of 12 hour of use. I was working on a mini itx comp build and figured this would be a good keyboard to use as it packs away in a very small space. But that was the only thing it is good at does not work at all anymore
customer_reviews.author: W. Rosenthal

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea...POOR Quality
customer_reviews.text: I LOVED, LOVED, LOVED this keyboard the first 3 times I used it. Now on the fourth use the upper rows of keys do not work. Really too bad as this was a really convenient product to leave in the box and rollout when I'm working remotely. I have to give it one star as the quality is so poor.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B.

customer_reviews.title: Returned - keys too hard to press and don't always work well
customer_reviews.text: May work for some and may have been just mine... Regardless of 'shaking' the keyboard of whatever they tell you to do, mine just was unresponsive on some keys at times. It's not easy typing on it.. not 'comfortable' really. It's nice that' it's quiet and rubbery, but requires a much harder push down on the keys which will slow you down significantly.
customer_reviews.author: Lead Singer

customer_reviews.title: Good product for what it is, but not truly compatible with Mac
customer_reviews.text: So far, this wired keyboard works as expected. If you are looking for a lightweight, portable, rollable, full-size, wired keyboard, this on will do the job. For normal Mac uses, the Sungwoo works, although the key placement takes some getting used to. But if you need to reboot a damaged computer or input Mac commands, the Mac does not respond to all commands because the Sungwoo is designed for Windows computers. Maybe this is true only on some models of the Mac (e.g., older macs) but it is annoying, since one advantage of a wired keyboard is that it is active even if the computer is dying, whereas a BT keyboard might not be recognized by a dying computer.
customer_reviews.author: Roo

customer_reviews.title: Simple, buttons are a little wonky, but that's expected.
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint that I have about this keyboard is that the buttons are a little difficult to actuate sometimes. Don't expect to be registering every key you try to hit and typing up long drafts with this keyboard. However, it is extremely portable and convenient, mine was fully functional, it's wired (no effective interference unless you're traveling through a black hole, which, I haven't seen any reviews from said individuals yet, and it's spill-resistant and easily cleanable. I bought this just for a PC-repair-go-bag that I put together. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Lane

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for working in a dusty environment!
customer_reviews.text: I work in a very dusty environment, and we had this keyboard all of us used on a daily basis that had so much dust caught in it that the keys would stick in the pressed position. Very annoying when trying to record anything. I finally got fed up with it and ordered this keyboard. Arrived in one day and I immediately took it to work and replaced our old keyboard. What used to take 15 minutes to type takes 2 minutes now that we have a keyboard that is dust proof. This keyboard is an amazing solution to our problem! Only slight downside is it is slightly smaller than a normal keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: SkareKrow

customer_reviews.title: the left 'shift' button failed and hasn't worked since 9which accounts for my poor punctuation0. i haven't learned how to use the ...
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard worked for about 6-months, but would randomly turn off/disconnect since i received it. This wasn't a deal-breaker for me, but about 3 weeks ago, the left 'shift' button failed and hasn't worked since 9which accounts for my poor punctuation0. i haven't learned how to use the right shift key for all of my capitalization, so there are errors in the grammar of this review. anyway, this keyboard will probably work as a spare, but not as a primary use keyboard. i wish i wouldn't have wasted my money on it.
customer_reviews.author: EazyTarGut

customer_reviews.title: Typing may be hard for some people
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for portability because you can just roll it up or fold it to carry it around. It is also waterproof so you don’t have to worry about this getting wet. The only downside for this product is typing. The silicon cover makes it very hard for me to type the keys. Maybe it is not an issue for other people but I personally didn’t enjoy how strong/hard I need to press the key in order to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: H.S.K

customer_reviews.title: Wasted my money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for travel as I use 10 key a lot and my laptop does not have one. Used it when it first delivered and seemed to work fine. Figured it would take a little time to get used to so seemed pretty pleased at that time. Went on business trip shortly after and tried using it again but low and behold, 3 digits on the 10 key now do not work. Put it back in my laptop bag intending on returning it but forgot to do so during return period and now stuck with $20 piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Jwalsh62

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I'm a lifelong gamer and I thought I would never be able to use one of these keyboards without losing my mind. I was completely wrong, I can use this keyboard just fine for everything: Typing, gaming, etc. I do type a little slower, and it is slightly more annoying than using a regular keyboard, but it's so much better than I thought it would be. It took less than a day for me to get used to it. For disability related reasons, I needed a keyboard that was as quiet as possible. Nothing even comes close to comparing to this in terms of how little noise it makes.
customer_reviews.author: RKK

customer_reviews.title: Not so great.
customer_reviews.text: It's much smaller than a reg key board causing many typo's and hitting wrong buttons that can cause you to lose your work if you are not careful. The longer I use it the worse the mistakes become, some keys don't respond well as far as pressure on them and several other probs. I thought I could get used to it but, I haven't and I've had it for several months. I live on my computer and this causes a lot of WTF's? all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel S. Croft

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: great idea, unfortunately it doesn't work very well. a lot of the keys either don't press at all or will register twice, typing accurately is nearly impossible. the keyboard doesn't even lay flat- the top kinda bubbles out, which probably makes the keys less accurate. the package also specifically states NOT to get water or drinks on it, which goes against the title that it's waterproof. would be a really cool idea if it was executed better, but instead it's just flimsy and unreliable
customer_reviews.author: Serena

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: The buttons are too squishy and quite frankly I found that super duper annoying! Seems like a nice product but this is my 1st roll up keyboard and I am not liking this one so far. What drives me bonkers about this keyboard is the key layout. There is a home key right next to the back space button so I feel like my fingers are off placement b/c there is something to the right of the backspace...which I usually hit and go to the top of a page or the beginning of a line in terminal.
customer_reviews.author: Hanzo

customer_reviews.title: Slow heavy touch one-finger typists, this is for you.  Anyone else ... nope.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fit to give someone you hate. WHO dreamed it up? As a 120 wpm typist with an ultralight touch (court reporter), this thing is torture. Space bar often doesn't register. Whack each key one at a time and hold your breath. It should be sold as what it is: fit for the mechanic at the auto parts store.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Sandstrom

customer_reviews.title: Soft but Small
customer_reviews.text: Cons: Small keys especially arrow keys & wish delete/enter/Crtrl keys were bigger. "power/USB adapter is on Right side, would next time get one on left side as when I use the keypad I think it's extra keys to press. Pros: Nice & quiet, good to order Grey & Black setup as it helps with typing. Had it for a week or so, & thus far it preforms nicely. Nice & flexible, can fit in pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Complimentary

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product, plug and play, no hassle, is quiet and easy to clean. Even sprayed it in the sink when I spilled coffee on it, no issues. Update: After about 3 months of so this stopped working. While it worked it was great but then the keys became unresponsive. At first I thought is was my USB ports but then I plugged it into as brand spanking new machine and had the same issues. Find something better/more expensive or you'll end up buying/spending more in your quest to save money.
customer_reviews.author: LO Rivera

customer_reviews.title: It’s an a era product in cost and function; there are better ones to see
customer_reviews.text: Size is convenient it’s not. Very esthetic as appearance the keyboard is bland connection cable white; it function but you have to apply a moderate amount of pressure on the key to activation therefore is not good if you want to write fast (you’re gonna miss some letters) if I had the choice I will use a normal hard plastic one.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: 99% silent keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Its a 99% silent keyboard, and it works. Great for working at night. Don't give it 5 stars because of the white cord. The keyboard is black and the cord should therefore be black. Basic aesthetics. As a keyboard it is extremely poor, zero feedback while typing results in constant typos .... yet, as already stated, it is great for working at night, and I do not evaluate it as a regular keyboard. I don't see the usefulness for traveling as ANY laptop keyboard is better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Nice feel and easily portable. Space bar and shift keys don't always work.
customer_reviews.text: I like this new keyboard. I needed something portable and it fits. It arrived a day early. My only complaint so far is the space bar does not work about 25% of the time. You have to hit it just right and I end up having to go back and fix the spaces. Similarly the shift keys are difficult to hit just right with your pinkey fingers so i have to go back and correct some capital letters and punctuation. Those things could use improvement but overall not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great product worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Perfect solution to a broken keyboard. I got this for a laptop I acquired that had a defective keyboard. I not only use it for that but also another laptop. The low profile, extreme durability makes this a great add for multiple uses beyond what I purchased it for. And I can indeed verify it is not only water proof, but diet soda proof as well.
customer_reviews.author: HomeboundAmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I bought these keyboard to travel with my laptop. I was also looking for a silent keyboard as when I am on the phone I don't want people to think I am not paying attention to them talking when I am typing. I like the print screen button, and the number pad to the side. A usb port is needed to plug the cord into a computer or laptop. Cons would be that for some reason I often mistakenly hit the "home" and "end" buttons with my right pinky finger.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: I’m Disappointed!!
customer_reviews.text: The spacing between keys is very limited. You need tiny hands. The keyboard is missing some of the keys I normally use, I.e., print screen, scroll lock, etc. But, most importantly, it’s a totally dark keyboard. You cannot type without the lights on. It needs lit keys or some type of paint that makes the keys visible in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Slows you down.
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty excited since I hate getting any crumbs in my keyboard. This keyboard will slow you down and I’m having a lot of issues of it registering the wrong key when I type in passwords. The number pad works great but the keyboard does not. I may end up returning it for that reason. I’m pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: H. Andersen

customer_reviews.title: doesnt lie flat
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is fine for occasional use, but it wont lie completely flat. I liked the compact size and the key feel of the silicone, and would be just fine when travelling with a laptop. But it is not suitable for every day use at a workstation.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska Hermit

customer_reviews.title: OK for the price, but has some flaws.
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact this this keyboard is spill-proof and portable. I bought it so I could have a portable, full-size keyboard for my mini laptop. It was serviceable and convenient on my many trips, but the key register was inconsistent. I had to hammer some keys (space bar) to get them to work and some other key presses would always produce duplicate letters no matter how softly I touched the key. For the price, it was worth the service time I got out of it, but out of frustration, I ended up replacing it with a hard keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hios

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard works poorly
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard works poorly, mostly because when you unroll it the keyboard never flattens enough and many keys do not actuate without pressing hard. No quick touch typing with this thing. I'm sorry I actually bought 3 of these. If it wasn't shipped rolled up in a box and was flat it might actually have been a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice little keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Item worked well. I use it for traveling and presenting. Beats carrying a full keyboard when I need to present a concept to a class. I gave it 4 stars only because it would have been nice if it came with little cloth carrying pouch. I have to roll it up and have a rubber band around it so that it can fit in my backpack
customer_reviews.author: Optimus Prime

customer_reviews.title: Buy this for one and only purpose.
customer_reviews.text: ... you need a keyboard to withstand pet hair and/or spills. It does perfect for that. But, it will not be easy to type with, and the placement of the circuit box will be in the way of the mouse for any desktop with. limited space
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: rubber Keyboard is FANTASTIC
customer_reviews.text: I love this rubber keyboard, when I'm using my lap top on a table, I don't have to reach or be too close to the screen. It works immediately upon plugging in and seamlessly! Now I have my numbers pad in a group on the right instead of reaching above the keys on my lap top.
customer_reviews.author: BuddyBoy

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this
customer_reviews.text: For a few weeks, it was working fine. The most I traveled with it, the most the keys weren't responding, and it eventually stopped working. Maybe because somehow when I fold it, it shortens the wires. But if it can roll, it should still be able to work, or at least smooth out whenever the wiring gets stuck. Smoothed it out and it didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Sagen

customer_reviews.title: Typos due to missing inputs, tired of correcting typos
customer_reviews.text: It's a great device if it works efficiently but unfortunately mine didn't. 6 out of 10 words I type were typos because the keyboard doesn't recognize the input unless you press the center of the keys pretty hard. It takes more time to go back to the typos and correct them. If you don't want any typos, there is only one way to go, press the keys really hard with your INDEX FINGERS ONLY
customer_reviews.author: Jina Shin

customer_reviews.title: Air bubble in material -  had to return
customer_reviews.text: This was a neat keyboard and definitely portable and silent; however, it had an air bubble within the material that never really settled (I gave it a couple of days) and made it too hard to use without a ton of errors. Returned it easily. Wish it would have worked because it was really cool.
customer_reviews.author: NGSpring

customer_reviews.title: be aware that sometimes some keys will stop working - the official way to fix this as recommended by the producer is is to roll it
customer_reviews.text: The main advantage is the product's portability (hence, more than one star). Nonetheless, it's not very usable, as you have to hit the keys very hard to get the result on the screen. Also, be aware that sometimes some keys will stop working - the official way to fix this as recommended by the producer is is to roll it, grab by the thick part (where the cable is), and flap it around. It does solve the problem, but you still have to hit the keys very hard. It's OK if portability is what you seek... AND if you are not planning to write a book using it. :)
customer_reviews.author: Kantuta

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a business trip to use and didn't have a lot of space so it seemed ideal. However the keyboard itself was not very good and I had to press down really hard and multiple times to get the keys to take. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Novelty !
customer_reviews.text: I'm actually surprised how well responsive the keys are. I'm actually testing out the keyboard by writing the review and up until this sentence it's been good ;D (so don't be surprised if the tone change haha) .... The keyboard lies almost flat on the surface ... which is nice. The rubbery keys are a little bit weird and take time to get used to but they work well. The only thing that bugged me was the fact that the Enter & Backspace key are very short ... which lead to me pushing the Home key right next to it three times now. but it's all good Great little novelty !
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: I do NOT like the home/page//end keys being located by the backspace/arrow key
customer_reviews.text: This does what I need it to. The keys are a little insensitive sometimes, and others too sensitive! I do NOT like the home/page//end keys being located by the backspace/arrow key; loses a full star due to constantly hitting them while trying to backspace or enter. I like how it feels; takes getting used to, but it's SO quiet! I'm not very accurate with it (normally type 90+ wpm, but the constant corrections for the misplaced keys cut me substantially) but hopefully that will improve with time.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonchilde

customer_reviews.title: It worked for a couple months, then gave out.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard worked for a couple months and stopped working shortly afterwards. It's great it you never need to use the number 4 or a dollar sign. So.... not so great, flimsy, and I regret purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Allyson K

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard is almost perfect. I love the size and it folds into ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a designated work space, so I was looking for something portable that will give me the feel of an office. This keyboard is almost perfect. I love the size and it folds into a compact roll to make carting it around easy. My only complaint is that the it takes a good 1 or 2 minutes to for the connection to sync up with my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Chocolate_T

customer_reviews.title: It actually works!
customer_reviews.text: Imagine my surprise when I unfurled this little guy and it actually worked. Very portable, compact and light weight. Great for the road or when you just want to make your friends laugh.
customer_reviews.author: Xamian

customer_reviews.title: Reliable keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. I have put this in my workplace which is fast food. Everyone is super hard on equipment and sort of clumsy. So I got this in hopes of no more broken keyboard or sticky keys and it went above and beyond. Still works months after purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Looks Great, Travels Great, but.....Does NOT Work
customer_reviews.text: Does what its supposed to do in the sense that it can be rolled up and portable, I give you that but too much pressure needs to be applied to the keys in order to make them work. Does not work. We purchased for work and no one uses them. They are in cupboard, I think we threw some away......
customer_reviews.author: Trini Haze

customer_reviews.title: Spilled liquid on laptop keyboard, this is to use ...
customer_reviews.text: Spilled liquid on laptop keyboard, this is to use on that laptop. Have only used it a little, seems to work ok. Will take some getting used to the different keyboard layout, and I will probably never get used to it, since I only use the laptop rarely. I saw somewhere someone posting about having to be careful about striking the keys in the center of the key, or else your stroke won't be 'recognized". I haven't found that to be the case yet, but I haven't typed hardly anything on it yet, so time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Reddog

customer_reviews.title: but comes in handy when traveling or with lesser-used electronics like TV's. You do have to press down on ...
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and does the job. It's not really meant to replace a regular keyboard for daily use, but comes in handy when traveling or with lesser-used electronics like TV's. You do have to press down on the keys with a bit more force than you would a regular keyboard, due to the softness of the keys, but it is effective. I meant to give this as a gift to someone to use along with an expensive tablet, but apparently, that tablet lacks a USB port (my fault for not checking) and thus can't connect to the tablet. Just keep compatibility in mind if you are looking to buy this product. Overall, I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: ehh. Its a cool consept.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to use this for gaming with my GPD win for gaming on the go. It doesnt always register a key press when typing and trying to press 2 or more keys at once does not work. So trying to use wasd and space at the same time will not work. It is too finicky to use practically, even as a backup keyboard. I know there are limitations with having a keyboard that rolls up but it is very frustrating to use.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: good and interesting
customer_reviews.text: I really liked that keyboard. As a programmer I have to write a lot though and it is not the best for heavy writing. The keys need to be really pushed. But it is a fun keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: Francois

customer_reviews.title: i like how flat it is and the keys feel responsive
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to use with my laptop, i like how flat it is and the keys feel responsive. My gripe with it is that the layout of the home, pageup/down, and end keys are really awkwardly placed so when I go to press enter, backspace, or shift I tend to hit those keys instead which throws off my typing rhythm. Other than that I enjoy it a lot. Also plays well with videogames if you're a gamer. Update: Several keys stopped working after 7 months. A little annoyed by that.
customer_reviews.author: TimeForWaffles

customer_reviews.title: the keys are easy to press
customer_reviews.text: The only issue I have with this keyboard is that the layout skimps on the up/down/left/right keys, so it doesn't match my regular keyboard. However, the keys are easy to press, and seem to work all the time. I touch type and expect the numeric keypad keys to be in a specific place so I don't have to look at the keyboard, and this works great. However, I always have to look down to use the insert/delete/up/down/left/right keys. Almost perfect, but it's amazingly good.
customer_reviews.author: Avid reader

customer_reviews.title: It's not a great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It's not a great keyboard. I guess it succeeds on being water resistant and foldable. I bought it to use near a CNC machine and it's nice to keep dust and chips from damaging the keys. You won't win any awards for typing on it though. It's clumsy and awkward to type on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great for what I bought it for: portable traveling keyboard with a number pad. If you're trying to win a wpm contest or something I wouldn't recommend it. Shipping was fast and it cam e in excellent condition.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: The keys are not as easy to use as a standard keyboard. Watch closely what you are typing because you must push the keys down harder.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Scott

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this keyboard. It is so easy to store when not in use. I can just roll it up and store it in the original box when using my touchscreen. This was a lifesaver for me. I recently bought a touchscreen laptop and spilled coffee on my keyboard ruining it. The monitor and touchscreen still work so I just plug this in to the USB port when I don't want to use the touchscreen. It saved me from having to buy a new laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon T.

customer_reviews.title: this is excellent. The keys are smooshy
customer_reviews.text: This is a true space safer. I have the old keyboard on a shelf, and can use it if I need it for serious writing. However, for just entering searches and such, this is excellent. The keys are smooshy. It is a different feel and takes a little getting used to. this is our first day with it, so cannot report on the durability of the keyboard. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great for on the road travel
customer_reviews.text: Rolls up to making it practical to pack in a bag with a small "headless" computer like a Mac Mini or Raspberry Pi. Add a 7" monitor an you have a replacement for that aging laptop.
customer_reviews.author: BamaJim

customer_reviews.title: No
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item twice for my 8 year old grandson. The first one lasted a year and A half ,I was happy . But the second one only lasted a little more than a month not happy with that at all.
customer_reviews.author: catt

customer_reviews.title: Just what i needed.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy a keyboard that I could carry around with me when I need to fix laptops in the office when that particular need came about. This barely takes up any space, weighs next to nothing compared to my other equipment, and works as you would expect of a keyboard. The feedback on the keys is a bit awkward, but if you put it on a hard flat surface it'll type reliably.
customer_reviews.author: William Ebert

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Clean!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a dozen of these for a medical office that needs to clean them constantly. They have worked very well for 2 months now and they have a good touch - not too flat. It is so much better than the plastic keyboard covers that always slipped and were difficult to clean. Plug and play - no problems. Bought french tip nail polish in case we remove the letters, but so far we haven't had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen F

customer_reviews.title: Some keys need a little harder press than normal
customer_reviews.text: It seems a little shoddy and misses a few key presses every now and then (I'm not the best typist to begin with). But it would be great in a small case with a portable HTPC
customer_reviews.author: K. L.

customer_reviews.title: Concept is good, but pressing the keys and getting an accurate ...
customer_reviews.text: Concept is good, but pressing the keys and getting an accurate response out of them is NOT good. Must be dead center of the key, and press slowly. Otherwise it will not type the letter, or produces a space where the character should be.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Steinritz

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Everyone was spilling stuff on the old keyboard, this one is great, easy to clean and it is durable. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for me when I needed a bigger keyboard than what my small laptop provided for doing college homework. I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Malinda R. Edmonds

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, perfect size and responsive keys
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with this keyboard so far. Easy to clean, noiseless, perfect size and incredible responsive keys. I use it at work. Totally recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Bond

customer_reviews.title: Not what you think
customer_reviews.text: It has to be on the hardest of surfaces and even then you have to type with force to get it to work in many cases. It will do for now but I should have saved my money and gotten something different
customer_reviews.author: S. Roberson

customer_reviews.title: Almost everything about this keyboard is great. Don't know why there is an extra key ...
customer_reviews.text: Almost everything about this keyboard is great. Don't know why there is an extra key near ALT on the left hand side, however. It's not always easy to see when the caps lock is on (or num lock for that matter). However compared to other similar keyboards, it's high quality, great keypress feedback on the fingers and for the size, the keys are a good size. Almost every key is in its place as the larger 104 key(boards).
customer_reviews.author: Anna P

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, we just didn't love it.
customer_reviews.text: Probably great for some but we couldn't find the right groove. It feels odd to use. Very portable and responsive though; a fine product, I'm sure just not our cup of tea.
customer_reviews.author: FDLLC

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but fails after 4mnths
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard was ordered to be used in conjunction with my laptop at my employers office. Very slim and light weight. One issue with this keyboard is that you have to press pretty firmly in order to get the keys to respond. The most important and noted issue with this keyboard it refused to function after 4 months of use. I kept getting non function errors. If you are looking to get a new key board look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as we'd hoped.
customer_reviews.text: Working in a laboratory where microbiological contamination is at a very high risk level, we disinfect everything. A standard keyboard would not do, and this product has performed admirably. It certainly takes some time to get used to the size & feel, but nothing else negative thus far.
customer_reviews.author: PETER Y.

customer_reviews.title: Practical portable or replacement keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is easy to use and very practical. Several keys on my laptop don't work as a result of my accidentally pouring liquid on it. The only disadvantage to the portable keyboard is that you have to press the keys firmly to make it work. However, the portable keyboard can be used to replace the inoperative keys on my computer and I can now type on the laptop without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Cerezo

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I was a little unsure about this product at first but it's so helpful just to be able to roll up and move out of the way
customer_reviews.author: A. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: I bought this after my last roll-up keyboard went defunct ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after my last roll-up keyboard went defunct. This keyboard has worked with everything I have plugged it into. All the keys work. I have not had the chance to wash it yet. The only down side I would give this keyboard is that it feels a bit small. I tend to "fat finger" just about everything.
customer_reviews.author: randomlyerratic

customer_reviews.title: Need fulfilled
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift. My mother-in-law was so excited and I haven't heard complaining about keys not working since.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Washack

customer_reviews.title: Not indestructable
customer_reviews.text: Not being water proof was what killed the last keyboard for our 7-8 year old users. Turns out the soft silicone covering of this keyboard provides almost no impact protection. It died in a week. I discovered the best way to protect the kids keyboard is to not buy them a new one for a month. If you can stand the whining. Ha.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Noir

customer_reviews.title: I actually really liked this keyboard when I got it
customer_reviews.text: I actually really liked this keyboard when I got it. It's convenient to use during meetings with my laptop and small enough to carry around in my computer bag. Unfortunately, that last time I tried to use it I discovered the keys on the left hand side of the board no longer work. I'm disappointed that I didn't get much use out of it before it broke and that I'm past my return window.
customer_reviews.author: LBednar

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard SUCKS!!
customer_reviews.text: Smetimes aa key works, sometimes not. Most of he time it types multple/doublr keystrokes at oncee or ddoesn't rcord aan nput key. Ths messsagee was typeedd wthyourkeyboard, yo see anytiing wrong with this?
customer_reviews.author: Duplo

customer_reviews.title: Great product, Happy with Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Travel the world, and do a lot of work a lot from hotel rooms and this keyboard works better than the keyboard on my laptop. Also rolls up and does not take up a lot of room in my rolling briefcase.
customer_reviews.author: Pink Diva

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less then 20 days...
customer_reviews.text: Honestly it was worth it while it worked. I ordered it on July 5th and was using to work from home and in the office and it's already broken as of July 21st. A bunch of the keys no longer work. And I wasn't doing anything with it that it says it couldn't do. Will be emailing the company hopefully for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Armbrister

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This works spectacularly! I am always spilling stuff on my keyboard and this is great. Just shake out the crumbs and do not worry f something spill, just shake that liquid off too. Kind of strange to type on at first as it feels different and squishy, but quiet and easy to get use too. I like it!
customer_reviews.author: Prairielady

customer_reviews.title: I was very pleased with the foldable keyboard for traveling
customer_reviews.text: After using the keyboard two months, it stopped working. Initially, I was very pleased with the foldable keyboard for traveling. But I would expect the product to work more than 2 months. I am going to check if it come with some kind of warranty. If not, I do not recommend buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for me
customer_reviews.text: The portable keyboard is exactly what I expected. Not fancy, but good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: kittybooks

customer_reviews.title: Nearly unusable
customer_reviews.text: Nearly unusable because it misses strokes so often. By typing very slowly and pressing very hard, one can use this keyboard, but be prepared to go back and fix many errors due to missed strokes. Great idea badly implemented.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: You have to press down very hard on the keys to type, which is a pain if you type fast.
customer_reviews.author: Tami

customer_reviews.title: still impressed me
customer_reviews.text: Although I bought the wrong item (wanted a wireless one) this did not feel like a cheap product, I didn't try it which is why I gave it the rating I did...still, I wish I had a use for it.
customer_reviews.author: moses lara

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my laptop. I'm very hard on my computers as I type for a living and had worn out multiple keys. This was a great alternative instead of buying a new laptop. It's a little smaller and takes some getting used to but otherwise love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product on recommendation from a friend. I like its portability and lightweight features. I would certainly recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Davis

customer_reviews.title: great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: this is a great keyboard, to my surprise it is very easy type on. the best part is how easy it is to clean. if the kids slop all over it, no [rpblem
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this a lot since I bought it to go with my laptop when I'm in a meeting or something & want a larger keyboard. It does take a little getting used to since the keys feel differently than a hard keyboard, but I'm happy with it for what I use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Keeping as a backup and replacing it with something better.
customer_reviews.text: It works but s key and e key are very sticky. All day use leaves my hands tired and sore because I have to pound these often used keys so hard. I would return it but too much trouble. Keeping as a backup and replacing it with something better.
customer_reviews.author: CC in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Hunt and peck or violent strike dream
customer_reviews.text: Keys are extremely rigid, if you're a violent data entry person this will do well for you.
customer_reviews.author: Saralizz76

customer_reviews.title: Takes getting use too
customer_reviews.text: Super soft keyboard, super lightweight, the heaviest part of the keyboard is where the plug comes out. The buttons take getting use too because with the standard keyboards, you don't have to hit the keys all the way down for the computer to register but this one you do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The description doesn't lie - the keyboard is durable, flexible and surprisingly bigger than I thought it would be. My only issue is some of they keys require a lot of pressure to respond. The price IMO is a great value. Spill a drink? Who cares. Just pick it up and dry it off.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler E.

customer_reviews.title: Carpal Tunnel problems solved!
customer_reviews.text: I have had Carpal Tunnel surgeries on both hands and wrist reconstruction on both wrists. I have always suffered with discomfort when using traditional keyboards but no more. This style keyboard allows your wrists to stay in a flat natural position when typing saving the pain suffered by using regular keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Robin huddler

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: It's good fro traveling, I don't have to worry about breaking it inside my luggage.
customer_reviews.author: José Guadalupe Mandujano

customer_reviews.title: After 2 weeks of using it, about 1/4 of ...
customer_reviews.text: After 2 weeks of using it, about 1/4 of the keys stop working. You have to push the keys to hard and your hand gets tired quickly. Update: After this review, I got an email from the seller. Shaking the keyboard in a vertical position makes the keys work again.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I liked it at first but, it's December 2016 and already - half of it does not work. I have been very careful with it - keeping it flat and in a drawer when at home, and carefully rolled up in my laptop bag on the go. The left side is dead =( So here I am trying to work, and my keyboard doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: Like the flexibility but the buttons didn't press right, a lot of glitches. Not that comfortable to use unless you use it on a hard surface
customer_reviews.author: Shariq

customer_reviews.title: The little keyboard that couldn't.
customer_reviews.text: I love how quiet this keyboard is and the feel. However, I bought this in December and just recently the bottom row of the keyboard stopped working (3 months to the day!). The number pad of the keyboard is really sensitive, sometimes the number will duplicate even though only pressed once.
customer_reviews.author: sccrstar23

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but it's very hard to type.
customer_reviews.text: I like how it's easy to clean and waterproof, but it's really hard to type. Also sometimes I have to press two times to type something. I wish they will make it softer so you can type very fast and easily.
customer_reviews.author: mahmudul hasan

product_meta.title: Sungwoo Foldable Silicone Keyboard USB Wired Waterproof Rollup Keyboard for PC Notebook Laptop (Black+Grey)
product_meta.description:
Portable, Durable and Comfortable 
☀ Ultra slim and compact, this keyboard is perfect for travel, school, or any working environment. Quiet keystroke is a good match for library use. 
☀ Convenient for taking along after rolled up. Easy for operation and storage. This multimedia flexible keyboard makes your web surfing a breeze. 
☀ Unique design and production process provide amazing usage experience, keys are quiet, stable, soft, and responsive, can be used in silent environment without disturbing other people. 
☀ Plug and play, no driver required, compatible with all computer, notebook, laptop (Windows XP, 2000, Vista, Mac OS) . Meanwhile support OTG function for Android phones. 

To protect the keyboard and extend service life, pls use the product properly and follow the tips below: 
✍ This product cannot be contacted with oil or organic impregnate like actone. 
✍ It cannot be pressed when it was rolled. 
✍ Do not place heavy objects on in a long time. 
✍ Do not pull or twist it, suggest rolling up the keyboard instead of folding hard when in need. 

Specification: 
☀ Power Supply: USB Interface 
☀ Size: 15.8 x 4.9 inches 
☀ USB wire length: 55 inches 
☀ Keyboard Button: 103 Keys 

Package Content: 
1 x Roll-up Silicone Keyboard 

Note: 
☞ As the keyboard is made of silicone, the silicone skin and circuit board inside the keyboard may stick together partially after long squeezing in transit, which may affect sensitivity of some keys. If you find some keys not very sensitive or do not work, pls pick up the keyboard, hold the indicator board and shake the whole keyboard for a moment (just keep it in vertical). It is to separate the silicone skin from the circuit board inside the unit and helps to restore its elasticity.
feature_bullets: ✅ Flexible, Soft, Foldable, Roll-up, Silent, Waterproof, Dustproof, Lightweight, Portable and easy to store. Multiple function make it an extraordinary computer keyboard!

✅ Soft silicone material: Made of high intensity and high elasticity silicone gel, non-toxic and odorless. Flexible material allow you to fold it or roll up freely, very handy and convenient to take with notebook, laptop and mac.

✅ Waterproof and dustproof: No additional keyboard cover skin required, food crumbs or dust can be easily cleaned thoroughly. Clean the silicone keyboard with water, alcohol, or alcohol based disinfectant.

✅ Silent Click: Soft material allows discreet silent typing experience. No typing sound design makes you have a quiet working environment and avoid disturbing others. At night, it can keep your family have a good sleep and also keep you do work seriously.

✅ Warm Tips: To protect the keyboard and extend service life, pls do not damage the item as following actions: stretch and twist keyboard; place heavy objscts on keyboard; spill liquid on keyboard; press on rolled up keyboard.

specifications.Operating System: Windows xp, Windows vista, Mac os
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars586 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
